contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox broadcast | call_letters = XHFN-TV| station_logo = [[Image:Aztecanoreste.png|125px]]<br><!-- Image with inadequate rationale removed: [[Image:Azteca7.png|125px]] -->| station_slogan = | station_branding = | analog = 7 ([[VHF]])| digital = 43 ([[Ultra high frequency|UHF]])<br />[[Virtual channel|Virtual]]: 7 ([[Program and System Information Protocol|PSIP]])| affiliations = [[Azteca 7]]| founded = unknown| location = [[Monterrey, Nuevo Leon]]| callsign_meaning = | owner = [[TV Azteca]]| effective_radiated_power = | homepage = [http://www.info7.com.mx/ TV Azteca Noreste]| }} '''XHFN-TV''' is the [[television call sign]] for the [[TV Azteca]] [[television station]] in [[Monterrey, Nuevo Leon]], [[Mexico]]. The station is affiliated to the [[Azteca 7]] network and also serves as a [[flagship (broadcasting)|flagship]] station to the Northeastern states of Mexico.<ref>[http://www.tvaztecanoreste.mx/plancomercial2011/cobertura.html TV Azteca Noreste website]</ref> Azteca 7 Noreste produces regional news, programming, and advertisement which is inserted during Azteca 7's national news feeds. Azteca Noreste is available to Mexican states of [[Nuevo Leon]], [[Tamaulipas]], and [[Coahuila]].<ref>[http://www.tvaztecanoreste.mx/plancomercial2011/cobertura.html TV Azteca Noreste coverage]</ref> Regular Azteca 7 programming can be seen XHFN's digital channel. == Digital television == {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Channel !! [[Video resolution|Video]] !! [[Aspect ratio|Ratio]] !! Callsign !! [[Television network|Network]] !! Programming |- | 7.1 || [[1080i]] || [[16:9]] || '''XHFN HD''' || [[Azteca 7]]-HD || Main XHFN HD Programming |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Monterrey TV}} {{Mexican broadcast television}} [[Category:Azteca 7 affiliates]] [[Category:Channel 7 TV stations in Mexico]] [[Category:Media in Monterrey]] {{Mexico-tv-station-stub}}
